abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Align Technology, Sunnyvale, Calif., to the San Francisco office of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of the TBWA Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, to handle advertising for the Invisalign System, a new product that promises to straighten teeth with plastic aligners rather than wire braces. Spending was estimated at $25 million.

Mangosoft, Westborough, Mass., a software services developer, to Mullen, Wenham, Mass., part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle its account, which had been inactive. Billings were estimated at $20 million. * Krystal Co., Chattanooga, Tenn., to McKinney & Silver, Raleigh, N.C., part of MarchFirst, to handle the account of the fast food chain, which had been at the Atlanta office of Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide, part of the WPP Group. Billings were estimated at $15 million.
